summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a forwarded message from the New Mexico Office of the Attorney General offering assistance to the Southern District of New York's federal investigation and expressing willingness to pursue state-level charges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; mentioned as having been arrested and facing federal charges.

persons.name: Assistant Attorney General
persons.context: Sender of the initial email offering assistance from the New Mexico Office of the Attorney General regarding Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Chief Deputy District Attorney
persons.context: Included on the initial email as a contact for discussing the matter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Responds to the initial email, thanking for the support and indicating the federal investigation will reach out if viable state-level charges are identified.

connections.description: Correspondence between state and federal prosecutors regarding coordination on the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Both are from the New Mexico Office of the Attorney General and are collaborating on offering assistance in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and is facing federal charges, as learned through media reports.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and facing federal charges as of July 2, 2020.
The New Mexico Office of the Attorney General proactively offered assistance to the federal prosecution and expressed willingness to pursue state-level charges.
The federal investigation, led by the Southern District of New York, acknowledged the offer and stated they would reach out if viable state charges not covered by their investigation were identified.
The email chain indicates inter-agency communication and potential for multi-jurisdictional prosecution.
